data.title: Oracle Financial Services Software subsidiary asked to pay Rs 80.4 crore to vendor
data.meta_description: IT firm Oracle Financial Services Software today said an arbitrator has passed an award amounting to Rs 80.4 cr against one of its subsidiaries.
data.text:
Synopsis

IT firm Oracle Financial Services Software today said an arbitrator has passed an award amounting to Rs 80.4 cr against one of its subsidiaries.

NEW DELHI: IT firm Oracle Financial Services Software (OFSS) today said an arbitrator has passed an award amounting to Rs 80.4 crore against one of its subsidiaries.

Elevate Your Tech Prowess with High-Value Skill Courses

Offering CollegeCourseWebsiteIndian School of BusinessISB Product ManagementVisitMIT xPROMIT Technology Leadership and InnovationVisitIIT DelhiCertificate Programme in Data Science & Machine LearningVisit

The firm, which provides IT products to the financial services industry, said the arbitrator erred in his assessment and ruling and therefore it will defend its position, OFSS said in a filing to the BSE.

"...in an arbitration proceeding between one of the company's subsidiaries and one of its vendors, an award has been passed by the arbitrator against the company's subsidiary for a sum of about Rs 804 million inclusive of interest," the filing said.

It added that the company believes the arbitrator erred in his assessment and ruling, and therefore "the company will vigorously defend its position by taking all necessary steps available under law".

The filing did not provide any further the details of the case.

The OFSS stock was trading at Rs 3,767.90, up 0.37 per cent, on the BSE.
